text: Pope Gregory III (; died 28 November 741) was a Syrian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 90th Pope from 11 February 731 to 28 November 741. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2013-3-12. ==Early life== Gregory was born in Syria, but the date of his birth is not known."Pope Gregory III," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-12. == Pope == Gregory was elected pope in 731. During his reign, the issue of iconoclasm or image worship was an important controversy.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1838). "Gregory III," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 11, p. 444. After the reign of Gregory III, there were no other non-European popes until Pope Francis in 2013.Goodstein, Laurie. "Pope Electors Are Sizing Up a Field of Peers," New York Times. February 16, 2013; Cockerton, Paul.
